importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the announcement of Ange Postecoglou's dismissal, marking the end of his 39-day tenure at Nottingham Forest.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The extremely short duration of Ange Postecoglou's management, making it the fastest managerial dismissal in Premier League history.

keyTakeAways: Ange Postecoglou was dismissed by Nottingham Forest after just 39 days as manager, following a 3-0 loss to Chelsea.
Postecoglou failed to win any of his matches, with only two draws and six losses in his tenure.
The club confirmed the dismissal in a statement released within 20 minutes of the match's conclusion.
This dismissal is the fastest in Premier League history according to Opta, one day quicker than Les Reed’s exit from Charlton Athletic in 2006.
Sam Allardyce is the only permanent manager in Premier League history to have had a shorter tenure than Postecoglou's, though he left by mutual consent.
Postecoglou joined the club after Nuno Espírito Santo's departure, who had led the team to a seventh-place finish — the best in 30 years.
Nuno Espírito Santo's exit was reportedly linked to a reported change in his relationship with club owner Evangelos Marinakis.
The team is now seeking its third manager of the season after Postecoglou's abrupt departure.
Postecoglou was booed by some fans after the defeat, indicating fan dissatisfaction with his performance and approach.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ange Postecoglou, the Australian football manager appointed at Nottingham Forest in late 2025, was dismissed after just 39 days in charge following a 3-0 defeat to Chelsea. During his tenure, he failed to win any matches, drawing two and losing six. The club confirmed the dismissal in a statement released within minutes of the match, marking the fastest managerial exit in Premier League history — a day quicker than Les Reed’s previous record. Postecoglou succeeded Nuno Espírito Santo, whose departure was reportedly tied to a strained relationship with club owner Evangelos Marinakis. The club now faces its third managerial change of the season, as fans expressed discontent with Postecoglou’s performance, and he was booed during the final game.
title: Ange Postecoglou Fired After Just 39 Days at Nottingham Forest
